ai-iti29:1.1_0: For this was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti29:2.1_0: “Mendicants, when a mendicant has two qualities they live happily in the present life—without distress, anguish, and fever—
ai-iti29:2.2_0: and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a good rebirth.
ai-iti29:2.4_0: Guarding the sense doors and moderation in eating.
ai-iti29:2.5_0: When a mendicant has these two qualities they live happily in the present life—without distress, anguish, and fever—
ai-iti29:2.6_0: When the body breaks up, after death, they can expect to be reborn in a good place.”
ai-iti29:3.2_0: The body is tranquil and mind.
ai-iti29:5.4_0: such a person lives in happiness.”
ai-iti29:6.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
